results.title: Carotid Artery Temperature Reduction with Statin Therapy in Patients with Familial Hyperlipidemia Syndromes
results.text_hl: Carotid artery temperatures were significantly reduced at 6 months in @<m>DISEASE_143890</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:143890 @@@FH@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who received hypolipidemic treatment (0.83 +- 0.34 versus 0.63 +- 0.24  C, p = 0.004 for @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, 1.00 +- 0.38 versus 0.69 +- 0.23  C, p < 0.001 for @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@simvastatin + ezetimibe@@@), but no change was recorded in controls (0.72 +- 0.26 versus 0.70 +- 0.26  C, p = 0.86).

citations.NLM: Benetos G, Galanakos S, Koutagiar I, Skoumas I, Oikonomou G, Drakopoulou M, Karmpalioti M, Katsi V, Tsioufis C, Toutouzas K. Carotid Artery Temperature Reduction with Statin Therapy in Patients with Familial Hyperlipidemia Syndromes J Clin Med. 2021 Oct 27;10(21):. PMID: 34768528
